did.abstract: Formed in 1977, Mobilization for Survival (MFS) is a national organization of local disarmament, anti-intervention, safe energy, religious and community organizations working for four goals: abolish nuclear weapons and power, stop military intervention, meet human needs, and reverse the arms race. The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection on Mobilization for Survival (1977-1984) contains materials created by Mobilization for Survival, including correspondence, press releases, newsletters, and reports.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from Democratic Socialists of America Records (TAM 105) in August 2024.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Formed in 1977, Mobilization for Survival (MFS) is a national organization of local disarmament, anti-intervention, safe energy, religious and community organizations working for four goals: abolish nuclear weapons and power, stop military intervention, meet human needs, and reverse the arms race. Activities of the organization include arranging educational programs, large teach-ins, development of resource materials, production of a newsletter, planning massive non-violent demonstrations and organizing local MFS chapters. As a multi-issue coalition MFS highlights the connections among nuclear weapons, military spending, and social and economic justice.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: This is an assembled collection of Mobilization for Survival Records (MFS) that were found within the DSA Records at the time of the DSA collection's processing. They were transferred to an assembled collection since they were created by Mobilization for Survival. Original provenance is unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in acid-free folders and boxes.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Collection on Mobilization for Survival (1977-1984) contains materials created by Mobilization for Survival. Materials include clippings, correspondence, fliers, documentation on training programs, reports from MSF chapters, documentation on various MFS campaigns, mailings, newsletters, and press releases.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
